content.description: Start low on the eastern face (the right side of the photo) on low quartz crimps. Move up the east face on quartz crimps and slopers before gaining a series of jugs to top out.The topout is easy, so a spotter isn't super necessary here.
content.location: It is on the east face following the chunks of quartz.

content.description: Start low on the southeast arÃªte with your hands matched at the underside of lowest shelf or crimp/sloper just above. Move up the southern face, directly beneath disconnected block, before making a somewhat committing topout over the block.I stood and jumped on the detached block up top, and it didn't move at all, but it still looks slightly sketchy. Climb at your own risk.
content.location: It is on the southeast arete and moves upwards on the south face directly up and over the obvious, detached block.

content.description: Mouse Bluffs has a couple quality, easy-intermediate problems a short distance from Squirrel Cave and The Chunk.
